com.johnsproject.jpos.graphics

Class GUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.johnsproject.jpos.graphics.GUI

  • public class GUI
extends java.lang.Object
    The GUI is the place where the buttons, images and so on are placed. It is drawn on top of the Space, this makes it always visible.
    Author:
    John Konrad Ferraz Salomon - John´s Project

        public void addButton(int x,
                      int y,
                      java.lang.String text,
                      javax.swing.Action action)
        Adds a button to the GUI at the specified position, text and action. With standard size (120x30).
        Parameters:
        x - the x position of the button.
        y - the y position of the button.
        text - the text of the button.
        action - the action of the button.

      • addImage

        public void addImage(int x,
                     int y,
                     java.lang.String path)
        Adds a JLabel with a image to the GUI at the specified position and path, with standard size (100x100).
        Parameters:
        x - the x position of the image.
        y - the y position of the image.
        path - the path of the image file.

        Parameters:

        y - the y position of the image.
        width - the width of the image.
        height - the height of the image.
